parameters.name: Override
parameters.description: True to display a value other than the actual dimension value, false to display the actual value

parameters.name: Value
parameters.description: Value to display instead of the actual dimension value

title: IDisplayDimension.SetOverride
description: Sets whether to display the actual dimension value or to display another value, and, if so, that value.
signature:
System.Boolean SetOverride( 
   System.Boolean
Override
,
   System.Double
Value
)

parameters.name: Override
parameters.description: True to display a value other than the actual dimension value, false to display the actual value

parameters.name: Value
parameters.description: Value to display instead of the actual dimension value

returns: True if setting an override value is successful, false if not
remarks:
This method can only be used on a display dimension in a drawing. In a part or assembly, this method takes no action and returns false.
If Override is set to false, then the Value argument is ignored.
Use
IDisplayDimension::GetOverride
to get whether the actual dimension value or another value is displayed.
Use
IDisplayDimension::GetOverrideValue
to get the value to display instead of the actual dimension value.
